page.title: 07LLANRHIDIAN PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: LLANRHIDIAN SCHOOL SERVES A LARGE AREA OF NORTH WEST GOWER,COMPRISING THE VILLAGES OF LLANRHIDIAN,LLANGENNITH AND LLANMADOC, AND THE HAMLETS OF OLD WALLS,BURRY GREEN,LLANDIMORE,CILIBION AND ILSTON.THE SCHOOL IS WITHIN A DESIGNATED AREA OF OUTSTANDING NATURAL BEAUTY AND CLOSE TO THE HERITAGE COASTLINE.CHILDREN COME FROM NEIGHBOURING FARMS AND SCATTERED HOUSING.THERE ARE COMPARATIVELY FEW WELSH SPEAKING FAMILIES IN THE AREA.MOST OF THE CHIDREN ARRIVE BY SERVICE BUS OPERATED BY SOUTH WALES TRANSPORT.THE OLDER PART OF THE SCHOOL,WHICH IS NOW THE HALL,WAS BUILT IN 1910.PRIOR TO THAT THE SCHOOL WAS HELD IN THE LOCAL CHURCH HALL.THE SCHOOL WAS REMODELLED IN 1981.THE NUMBER ON ROLL IS 100.THE SCHOOL IS USED BY THE COMMUNITY IN THE EVENING.
